BNPB: Alat Peringatan Dini Tsunami di Lampung Jadi Korban Vandalisme
03 Nov 2019, 02:49 by Audrey Santoso
Jakarta - Inexpensive Device for Sea Level Measurement (IDSL) atau alat peringatan dini tsunami di Pulau Sebesi, Lampung menjadi korban aksi vandalisme. Kabel aki yang terpasang pada alat tersebut dipotong oleh orang tak bertanggung jawab.
"BNPB (Badan Nasional Penanggulangan Bencana) mengimbau semua pihak, khususnya masyarakat, untuk turut menjaga alat peringatan dini tsunami. Hal tersebut mengingat beberapa waktu lalu vandalisme terjadi terhadap alat IDSL yang terpasang di sekitar Pulau Sebesi, Lampung," kata Kepala Pusat Data, Informasi dan Humas BNPB, Agus Wibowo, dalam siaran persnya, Sabtu (2/11/2019).
Aksi vandalisme itu, kata Agus, diketahui pada Oktober lalu. Beruntung, alat itu masih berfungsi meski dalam kondisi dirusak.
"Perusakan dilakukan pada kabel aki pada Oktober lalu. Meskipun saat itu kabel terpotong, alat masih dapat berfungsi karena menggunakan solar panel. Dapat dibayangkan apabila ada oknum yang sengaja merusak atau mengambil komponen alat ini sehingga tidak mampu lagi hidup dan memberikan sinyal peringatan dini," ujar Agus.

BNPB: Early Tsunami Warning Tool in Lampung Becomes Vandalism Victim
03 Nov 2019, 02:49 by Audrey Santoso
Jakarta - Inexpensive Devices for Sea Level Measurement (IDSL) or tsunami early warning tools on Sebesi Island, Lampung became victims of vandalism. Battery cable installed in the device is cut by irresponsible people.
"BNPB (National Disaster Management Agency) urges all parties, especially the public, to take part in safeguarding tsunami early warning devices. This is because some time ago vandalism occurred against IDSL devices installed around Sebesi Island, Lampung," said Head of Data, Information Center and BNPB Public Relations, Agus Wibowo, in his press release on Saturday (11/02/2019).
The vandalism, Agus said, was discovered last October. Luckily, the device was still functioning even though it was damaged.
"The damage was done to the battery cable last October. Even though the cable was cut at the time, the tool can still function because it uses solar panels. It can be imagined if there are individuals who intentionally damage or take the components of this tool so they are no longer able to live and provide an early warning signal," said Agus.
